This page lists the tutorials offered by LADAL - if you want to check out a tutorial, simply click on the title of the tutorial and you will taken directly sent to the respective website.

# Data Science Basics

```{r ws4, echo=FALSE, out.width= "25%", out.extra='style="float:right; padding:2px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/hapcom.png")
```

**[Working with Computers](https://slcladal.github.io/comp.html)**   

This tutorial provides advice and general tips on how to keep your computer clean and running smoothly, how to organize files and folders, and how to store your data safely and orderly.

**[Data Management and Reproducibility](https://slcladal.github.io/repro.html)**

This tutorial introduces basic data management techniques, version control measures, and issues relating to reproducible research.

**[Introduction to Quantitative Reasoning](https://slcladal.github.io/introquant.html)**

This tutorial takes a philosophical or history-of-ideas approach and introduces the logical and cognitive underpinnings of the the scientific method. 

**[Basic Concepts in Quantitative Research](https://slcladal.github.io/basicquant.html)**

This tutorial introduces basic concepts of data analysis and quantitative reserach.

# R Basics

```{r rs, echo=FALSE, out.width= "40%", out.extra='style="float:right; padding:2px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/RStudioscreenshot.png")
```

**[Why R?](https://slcladal.github.io/whyr.html)**

This site provides our reasoning for focusing (almost exclusively) on R in LADAL.

**[Getting started](https://slcladal.github.io/intror.html)**

This tutorial shows how to get started with R and it specifically focuses on R for analyzing language data but it offers valuable information for anyone who wants to get started with R. 

**[String Processing](https://slcladal.github.io/string.html)**

This tutorial introduces string processing and this can be used when working with language data. 

**[Regular Expressions](https://slcladal.github.io/regex.html)**

This tutorial introduces regular expressions and how they can be used when working with language data.

**[Handling tables in R](https://slcladal.github.io/table.html)**

This tutorial shows how to work with tables and how to tabulate data in R.

# Data Visualization

```{r mc, echo=FALSE, out.width= "40%", out.extra='style="float:right; padding:2px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/ozmap.png")
```

**[Introduction to Data Viz](https://slcladal.github.io/introviz.html)**

This tutorial introduces data visualization using R and shows how to modify different types of visualizations in the ggplot framework in R.

**[Data Visualization with R](https://slcladal.github.io/dviz.html)**

This tutorial introduces different types of data visualization and how to prepare your dat for different plot types.



**[Introduction to Geospatial Data Visualization](https://slcladal.github.io/gviz.html)**

This tutorial introduces geo-spatial data visualization in R. 

**[Interactive Charts](https://slcladal.github.io/motion.html)**

This tutorial shows how to generate interactive data visualizations in R.

# Statistics

```{r reg, echo=FALSE, out.width= "40%", out.extra='style="float:right; padding:2px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/reg.png")
```

**[Descriptive Statistics](https://slcladal.github.io/dstats.html)**

This tutorial focuses on how to describe and summarize data in R.

**[Basic Inferential Statistics](https://slcladal.github.io/basicstatz.html)**

This tutorial introduces basic inferential procedures for null-hypothesis hypothesis testing.

**[Regression Analysis](https://slcladal.github.io/regression.html)**

This tutorial introduces regression analyses (also called regression modeling) using R. Regression models are among the most widely used quantitative methods in the language sciences to assess if and how predictors (variables or interactions between variables) correlate with a certain response.

```{r boru, echo=FALSE, out.width= "40%", out.extra='style="float:right; padding:2px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/boruta.png")
```

**[Tree-Based Models](https://slcladal.github.io/tree.html)**

This tutorial focuses on tree-based models and their implementation in R. 

**[Cluster and Correspondence Analysis](https://slcladal.github.io/clust.html)**

This tutorial introduces classification and clustering using R. Cluster analyses fall within the domain of classification methods which are used to find groups or patterns in data or to predict group membership. 

<br>

```{r clust, echo=FALSE, out.width= "30%", out.extra='style="float:right; padding:2px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/phylo.png")
```

**[Introduction to Lexical Similarity](https://slcladal.github.io/lexsim.html)**

This tutorial introduces Text Similarity, i.e. how close or similar two pieces of text are with respect to either their use of words or characters (lexical similarity) or in terms of meaning (semantic similarity).

**[Semantic Vector Space Models](https://slcladal.github.io/svm.html)**

This tutorial introduces Semantic Vector Space (SVM) modeling R. SVMs are used to find groups or patterns in data or to predict group membership. 

**[Power Analysis](https://slcladal.github.io/pwr.html)**

This tutorial introduces power analysis using R. Power analysis is a method primarily used to determine the appropriate sample size for empirical studies.

# Text Analytics

```{r cl, echo=FALSE, out.width= "30%", out.extra='style="float:right; padding:2px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/wcloud.png")
```

**[Introduction to Text Analysis](https://slcladal.github.io/introta.html)**

This tutorial introduces Text Analysis, i.e. computer-based analysis of language data or the (semi-)automated extraction of information from text.

**[Concordancing (keywords-in-context)](https://slcladal.github.io/kwics.html)**

This tutorial introduces how to find words or phrases in text and display concordances, a so-called keyword-in-context (KWIC) display, with R.

**[Network Analysis](https://slcladal.github.io/net.html)**

This tutorial introduces network analysis using R. Network analysis is a method for visualization that can be used to represent various types of data.

**[Co-occurrence and Collocation Analysis](https://slcladal.github.io/coll.html)**

This tutorial introduces collocation and co-occurrence analysis with R and shows how to extract and visualize semantic links between words.

```{r nt, echo=FALSE, out.width= "40%", out.extra='style="float:right; padding:2px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/romeonet.png")
```

**[Topic Modeling](https://slcladal.github.io/topicmodels.html)**

This tutorial introduces topic modeling using R.

**[Sentiment Analysis](https://slcladal.github.io/sentiment.html)**

This tutorial introduces sentiment analysis (SA) and shows how to perform a SA in R.

**[Tagging and Parsing](https://slcladal.github.io/tagging.html)**

This tutorial introduces part-of-speech tagging and syntactic parsing using R.

**[Automated Text Summarization](https://slcladal.github.io/txtsum.html)**

This tutorial shows how to summarize texts automatically using R by extracting the most prototypical sentences.

**[Text Analysis and Distant Reading](https://slcladal.github.io/textanalysis.html)**

This tutorial introduces Text Analysis, i.e. computer-based analysis of language data or the (semi-)automated extraction of information from text.


# Case Studies 

```{r lik, echo=FALSE, out.width= "30%", out.extra='style="float:right; padding:2px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/likert.png")
```


**[Corpus Linguistics with R](https://slcladal.github.io/corplingr.html)**

This section presents different case studies or use cases that highlight how to do corpus-based analyses by implementing procedures shown in other LADAL tutorials.

**[Analyzing learner language using R](https://slcladal.github.io/llr.html)**

This tutorial focuses on learner language and how to analyze differences between learners and L1 speakers of English using R. 

**[Lexicography and Creating Dictionaries with R](https://slcladal.github.io/lex.html)**

This tutorial introduces lexicography with R and shows how to use R to create dictionaries and find synonyms through determining semantic similarity in R.

**[Visualizing and Analyzing Questionnaire and Survey Data](https://slcladal.github.io/surveys.html)**

This tutorial offers some advice on what to consider when creating surveys and questionnaires, provides tips on visualizing survey data, and exemplifies how survey and questionnaire data can be analyzed.

```{r vc, echo=FALSE, out.width= "40%", out.extra='style="float:right; padding:2px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/vc.png")
```

**[Creating Vowel Charts in R](https://slcladal.github.io/vc.html)**

This tutorial exemplifies how to create a vowel chart with Praat and R.

**[Computational Literary Stylistics with R](https://slcladal.github.io/litsty.html)**

This tutorial focuses on computational literary stylistics (also digital literary stylistics) and shows how fictional texts can be analyzed by using computational means.

**[Practical phylogenetic methods for linguistic typology](https://slcladal.github.io/phylo.html)**

This tutorial shows how you can do phylogenetic analysis in R.

**[Reinforcement Learning and Text Summarization in R](https://slcladal.github.io/reinfnlp.html)**

This tutorial introduces the concept of Reinforcement Learning (RL), and how it can be applied in the domain of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and linguistics.

# How-Tos

```{r pdf, echo=FALSE, out.width= "40%", out.extra='style="float:right; padding:2px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/pdf0.png")
```


**[Converting PDFs to txt](https://slcladal.github.io/pdf2txt.html)**

This tutorial shows how to extract text from one or more pdf-files using optical character recognition (OCR) and then saving the text(s) in txt-files on your computer.

**[Web Crawling using R](https://slcladal.github.io/webcrawling.html)**

This tutorial introduces web crawling and web scraping with R.

**[Downloading Texts from Project Gutenberg](https://slcladal.github.io/gutenberg.html)**

This tutorial shows how to download and clean works from the Project Gutenberg archive using R. Project Gutenberg is a data base which contains roughly 60,000 texts for which the US copyright has expired.

**[Renaming files with R](https://slcladal.github.io/rename.html)**

This tutorial shows you how you can rename files using R. This tutorial will show you how you can use R to rename many files in an easy way.
